Posts.Content: Mel63 wrote: Hello all,  After lurking around for a couple of weeks thought it was time to jump on and say hello. I havent been diagnosed withbc but have been on the six month check for 8 years. I haven't been good about the checks for the last 12months, the last time i went to doctors was with what i thought was a pulled muscle under my arm and long dent down breast. Had u/s i have enlarged lymph node underarm but dont worry that could be caused by anything dent is probably a collapsed vein. Was not happy with that so went to surgeon to get his thoughts on it. Well waste of time that was. Decided i will get health insurance waiting period is 12 months, that times up on may1. Fast forward to now still have uncomfortable feeling like a ball under my arm, shoulder and shoulder blade pain and feel a lump in side of breast. I do have lots of simple cysts and fibrous tissues but this lump does feel different. Have a mammo booked for next week so will see what that says before i make drs appointment. I have spent time researching breast specialists in my area and know which one i am going to insist on seeing. Its now time for answers no more wait and see.  mel Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: hello.... my first post Mel63 Mel63

Posts.Content: Mel63 wrote: I have been on 6monthly checks for 8 years now. Just over a year ago I started to have a lot of underarm pain. I had a mammo and u/s that showed one enlarged node under my arm. That pain now is underarm, side of breast, shoulder, shoulderblade  and along collarbone. I have cysts, dense breasts and fibrous tissues. I had a screening mammo just before Easter but no results yet. I have read with dense breasts mammos can miss things. All u/s I have had they will only check exactly where the dr has asked and not where I want. So I thought before I go asking for a referral for a ct I would ask for opinions to see if maybe a ct would be a better option than another u/s. Thanks in advance for your input. Mel Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Would a ct be better than u/s Mel63 MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2014 06:19AM Mel63 wrote: Hi mjm, great news that your lumps were b9, hope mine turn out to be more cysts but we'll wait and see, strangely i'm not worrying myself sick this time even though its completly different to every other time. Hope you get plently of rest and recover quickly from your surgery
